topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack(R) 1.1: TripleO Service Overview

body.p: TripleO (OpenStack(R)-On-OpenStack(R) is a service that handles installing, upgrading and operating OpenStack(R) clouds using OpenStack(R) cloud facilities as the foundation. TripleO builds on the Compute, Networking and Orchestration services to automate fleet management for as few as two machines or a full data center.
The HPE Helion OpenStack(R) installation follows the standard TripleO deployment model, creating a seed, an undercloud and an overcloud.

li.p: seed - The seed cloud is a bootable image that is deployed in a VM instance. This image, which is provided as part of HPE Helion OpenStack(R) contains the minimum services required for OpenStack(R) to function and to provision physical hardware to deploy the undercloud.

undercloud - The undercloud server is a basic single-node OpenStack(R) installation running on a single physical server used to deploy, test, manage, and update the overcloud servers. There is no HA configuration for the undercloud. It contains a strictly limited sub-set of OpenStack(R) services; just enough to permit interaction with the overcloud.
overcloud - The overcloud is the functional cloud available to end users for running guest virtual machines and workloads.

section.title: For more information
section.p: For information on TripleO, see the official OpenStack(R) TripleO wiki.
For more information on the HPE Helion OpenStack(R) deployment model, see HPE Helion OpenStack(R) Technical Overview.
